intro: Gyrostachys xyridifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its low water requirements, it is often used in xeriscaping and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
